definition: a step/a pace/walk/march/stages in a process/situation
to have difficulty walking (idiom)/to walk with difficulty

sentences.english: The old basketball star walks gingerly on aching knees.
sentences.chinese: 年邁的籃球明星會因膝蓋的傷痛步履蹣跚。

sentences.english: There's a spring in his step, perhaps because he'll be home soon.
sentences.chinese: 他步履輕快，如沐春風，也許是因爲他快要回家了。

sentences.english: Move your ass, man, we've got a lot work to do.
sentences.chinese: 步履起來，伴計，本人們還有良多事要做呢。

sentences.english: The hungry marchers shambled slowly along the road.
sentences.chinese: 行軍的人餓得步履蹣跚在路上慢慢走着。

sentences.english: Running at 24 frames per second, that's the pace of Mark Lee.
sentences.chinese: 他永遠往前跑，一秒二十四格，是李屏賓的步履節奏。

sentences.english: There was a stream of refugees trudging up the valley towards the border.
sentences.chinese: 一隊難民步履艱難地爬上山谷向着邊境走去。

sentences.english: If credit growth roars on, the Chinese central bank will have a lot of trouble controlling inflation.
sentences.chinese: 如果信貸持續增加，央行控制通貨膨脹將步履維艱。

sentences.english: I could see so clearly from your light-footed running to me that you must have had a joy in your heart.
sentences.chinese: 從你輕快的步履，我能清楚地知道你內心的歡欣。

sentences.english: The prone shadows with their outstretched arms clung to the feet of the hurrying light.
sentences.chinese: 竹影斑駁錯落，掙扎著纏繞光陰匆忙的步履。

sentences.english: The old woman walked across the road in small steps.
sentences.chinese: 那位老太太步履蹀躞地橫過馬路。

sentences.english: The men in recon were clumsy now and uncertain of their footing .
sentences.chinese: 偵察排的戰士到這時候又都腿腳不靈，步履不穩了。

sentences.english: O shade, so sedate and decorous by day, with calm countenance and regulated pace;
sentences.chinese: 啊，白日裏那麼沉着和端莊，狀貌安詳，步履均勻。

sentences.english: Please speed up and walk into the enthusiastic summer and further towards autumn when golden fruits hang down from thousands of trees.
sentences.chinese: 請加速步履，走進熱情之夏，走向千樹懸金的季節。

sentences.english: The Awakened One whether does or does not do, does not try.
sentences.chinese: 醒覺的人無論步履與否，都沒有盡力嘗試的成分。

sentences.english: As you clamber down on to the platform, you stumble as clumsily as a calf.
sentences.chinese: 當你下到站臺上時步履笨拙像一頭牛犢。

sentences.english: The old man plods along, hardly able to lift each foot.
sentences.chinese: 那老人步履艱難地走着，雙腳幾乎都提不起來。

definition: to walk unsteadily/to stagger/to lurch/to hobble/to totter
striding forward with head high (idiom); to walk with spirited and vigorous step/to strut
neither too fast nor too slow (idiom)
to tread/to stamp/to step on/to press a pedal/to investigate on the spot
